intro: Exallage pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited exallage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
